name: market for concrete, 30MPa | concrete, 30MPa | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25129/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset represents 1m3 of 30MPa ready-mix concrete, exposure classes XC3/XD2/XF1/XA1 (typically referred to as B2 in Austria) and XC3 (typically referred to as B1 in Austria) delivered at the construction site. 30 MPa concrete is intended for building structures in general, exposed to freeze-thaw, including residential, commercial and industrial uses. Transport distances were based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007. Uncertainty was adjusted accordingly. Refer to the Global transport model available in the support section of the ecoinvent website (https://www.ecoinvent.org/home.html).

From concrete plant gate, with concrete mixer truck already loaded.

This activity ends at the construction site where the ready-mix concrete is delivered. The dataset includes the ready-mix concrete and its transportation to the construction site.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2395:Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period was set identical to the corresponding transformation activity.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Austrian data. Due to its characteristics, ready-mix concrete is only traded locally.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Unspecified lorry was considered as a proxy to represent Austrian fleet technology
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Adjusted transport distances from transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics.
